page.title: 15BRITISH RAIL TRAINING CENTRE
page.content: {The Civil Engineers Training Centre}is on the Grove Estate bordering Watford. The estate was owned by the Earl of Clarendon and has been a training centre for 16 years.The BRTC moved from Euston to here during the war. Unemployed people helped build work- shops,classrooms,bomb shelters etc. There are 3 different training courses including:Permanent Way(trackwork), Plant(Machinery) and Works(repairs to bridges,buildings and signal boxes). In the grounds there is an old bridge which students are asked to give a structural report on.There is also an iron girder from London Bridge and about 100m of track.In one of the workshops students are shown how to adjust track.The students work from 9am to 4.45pm daily and have to pass an exam at the centre before they qualify as Civil Engineers.
